org.hibernate.testing.junit5.envers

Class EnversSessionFactoryScope

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hibernate.testing.junit5.envers.EnversSessionFactoryScope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DialectAccess, SessionFactoryAccess

    public class EnversSessionFactoryScope
extends Object
implements SessionFactoryAccess
    A scope or holder for the SessionFactory instance associated with a given test class. Used to:
    • Provide lifecycle management related to the SessionFactory

      • inSession

        public void inSession(Consumer<SessionImplementor> action)
        Invoke a lambda action inside an open session without a transaction-scope. The session will be closed after the action completes, regardless of failure.
        Parameters:
        action - The lambda action to invoke.

      • inSession

        public void inSession(SessionFactoryImplementor sfi,
                      Consumer<SessionImplementor> action)
        Invoke a lambda action with an open session without a transaction-scope. The session will be closed after the action completes, regardless of failure.
        Parameters:
        sfi - The session factory.
        action - The lambda action to invoke.

      • inTransaction

        public void inTransaction(Consumer<SessionImplementor> action)
        Invoke a lambda action with an open session inside a new transaction. The session will be closed after the action completes, regardless of failure. The transaction will be committed if successful; otherwise it will be rolled back.
        Parameters:
        action - The lambda action to invoke.

      • inTransaction

        public void inTransaction(SessionFactoryImplementor sfi,
                          Consumer<SessionImplementor> action)
        Invoke a lambda action with an open session inside a new transaction. The session will be closed after the action completes, regardless of failure. The transaction will be committed if successful; otherwise it will be rolled back.
        Parameters:
        sfi - The session factory.
        action - The lambda action to invoke.

      • inTransaction

        public void inTransaction(SessionImplementor session,
                          Consumer<SessionImplementor> action)
        Invoke a lambda action inside a new transaction but bound to an existing open session. The session will not be closed after the action completes, it will be left as-is. The transaction will be committed if successful; otherwise it will be rolled back.
        Parameters:
        session - The session to bind the transaction against.
        action - The lambda action to invoke.

      • inTransaction

        public <R> R inTransaction(Function<SessionImplementor,R> action)

      • inTransaction

        public <R> R inTransaction(SessionFactoryImplementor sfi,
                           Function<SessionImplementor,R> action)

      • inTransaction

        public <R> R inTransaction(SessionImplementor session,
                           Function<SessionImplementor,R> action)

      • inTransactions

        @SafeVarargs
public final void inTransactions(Consumer<SessionImplementor>... actions)
        Invoke a series of lambda actions bound inside their own transaction-scope but bound to the same session. The session will be closed after the actions complete, regardless of failure. The transaction associated with lambda will be committed if successful; otherwise it will be rolled back. Should a lambda action fail, the remaining actions will be skipped.
        Parameters:
        actions - The lambda actions to invoke.

      • inAuditReader

        public void inAuditReader(Consumer<AuditReader> action)
        Invoke a lambda action against an AuditReader bound to a newly allocated session. The audit reader instance will be automatically allocated and provided to the lambda. The underlying session will be automatically opened and closed.
        Parameters:
        action - The lambda action to invoke.
